intro: Cacalia nardosmia var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth cacalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and compound leaves that are finely divided. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Due to its delicate appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
